claim: Vaccination with a higher-dose recombinant flu vaccine may induce a more robust antibody response than egg-based standard-dose vaccines.

rejected_evidence.quote: RIV4 (recombinant HA vaccine) induces higher post-vaccination antibody titers compared with standard-dose, egg-based inactivated influenza vaccines, particularly in older adults.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote directly states that the recombinant HA vaccine (RIV4) leads to higher antibody titers after vaccination compared to standard-dose, egg-based vaccines, supporting the claim that a higher-dose recombinant flu vaccine may induce a more robust antibody response.
